sections.title: statement
sections.content: Lachlan Kermode is an audiovisual engineer who specializes in systems development, machine learning, and augmented media systems. He is currently software lead at London-based research agency Forensic Architecture, where he develops research tools and workflows to enhance human rights research using multi-media systems. He has a degree in Computer Science from Princeton University, and has worked across industry, research, and artistic contexts.

body.title: Forensic Architecture
body.content: I direct engineering for full stack platforms, 3-D data pipelines, and machine learning workflows. I also sit on our data management committee for digital security, and offer expertise across investigations that are computer oriented. See forensic-architecture.org for more information.

body.title: Full Stack Systems Engineer
body.content: I worked across several technical contexts in industry, from developing mobile applications in Swift and Objective C, to building full stack applications from scratch in Node, React, and React Native, to infrastructure and backend optimization in Docker, Ansible, Python, Golang and various other languages.

body.title: Triangle Club Writers Workshop
body.content: Wrote and produced three full-length musical comedies as part of a 12-person creative workshop. Primarily responsible for music and lyrics, I wrote upwards of 15 songs that were produced as part of the annual Princeton Triangle show.

body.title: Triple Chaser: Whitney Museum
body.content: In collaboration with Laura Poitras/Praxis Films, I trained computer vision machine learning classifiers to detect Safariland tear gas canisteres among the millions of images shared online, using an innovative technique of training using synthetic data rendered from photorealistic 3-D scenes.

body.title: Through the Internet: 3-D Animated Short
body.content: A 3-minute animated short depicted the journey of a data packet from a cellphone in Madrid to a Facebook data center in New Jersey. TTI is a project of 'animated documentary', an ongoing set of projects that looks to think algorithmic metaphor through its spatial consistency by visualising algorithms in 3-D animation.

body.title: Paideia Creative Residency
body.content: I helped to workshop and write a full-length musical based on the Euripides drama "'Ἑλένη", which was later produced into a cast EP by broadway actors.
